title: [JIT] ArgumentStash error with mnist example under training
body_html:
Example:

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Net(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Net, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 10, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(10, 20, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2_drop = nn.Dropout2d()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(320, 50)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(50, 10)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv1(x), 2))
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv2_drop(self.conv2(x)), 2))
        x = x.view(-1, 320)
        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x))
        x = F.dropout(x, training=self.training)
        x = self.fc2(x)
        return F.log_softmax(x, dim=1)

net = Net()
torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(5, 1, 28, 28))(net)

Produces the following error:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mnist.py", line 24, in <module>
    torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(5, 1, 28, 28))(net)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 305, in wrapper
    module._create_method_from_trace('forward', func, args)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 468, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "mnist.py", line 16, in forward
    x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv2_drop(self.conv2(x)), 2))
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 468, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/dropout.py", line 92, in forward
    return F.dropout2d(input, self.p, self.training, self.inplace)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py", line 589, in dropout2d
    return _functions.dropout.FeatureDropout.apply(input, p, training, inplace)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/_functions/dropout.py", line 41, in forward
    ctx.noise = ctx.noise.expand_as(input)
RuntimeError: torch/csrc/autograd/generated/VariableType.cpp:24347: expand_as: Assertion `jit::tracer::ArgumentStash::empty()` failed.
body_text:
Example:
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Net(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Net, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 10, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(10, 20, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2_drop = nn.Dropout2d()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(320, 50)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(50, 10)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv1(x), 2))
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv2_drop(self.conv2(x)), 2))
        x = x.view(-1, 320)
        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x))
        x = F.dropout(x, training=self.training)
        x = self.fc2(x)
        return F.log_softmax(x, dim=1)

net = Net()
torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(5, 1, 28, 28))(net)

body:
Example:

```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F

class Net(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super(Net, self).__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 10, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(10, 20, kernel_size=5)
        self.conv2_drop = nn.Dropout2d()
        self.fc1 = nn.Linear(320, 50)
        self.fc2 = nn.Linear(50, 10)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv1(x), 2))
        x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv2_drop(self.conv2(x)), 2))
        x = x.view(-1, 320)
        x = F.relu(self.fc1(x))
        x = F.dropout(x, training=self.training)
        x = self.fc2(x)
        return F.log_softmax(x, dim=1)

net = Net()
torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(5, 1, 28, 28))(net)

```

Produces the following error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "mnist.py", line 24, in <module>
    torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(5, 1, 28, 28))(net)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 305, in wrapper
    module._create_method_from_trace('forward', func, args)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 468, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "mnist.py", line 16, in forward
    x = F.relu(F.max_pool2d(self.conv2_drop(self.conv2(x)), 2))
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 468, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/modules/dropout.py", line 92, in forward
    return F.dropout2d(input, self.p, self.training, self.inplace)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/functional.py", line 589, in dropout2d
    return _functions.dropout.FeatureDropout.apply(input, p, training, inplace)
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/nn/_functions/dropout.py", line 41, in forward
    ctx.noise = ctx.noise.expand_as(input)
RuntimeError: torch/csrc/autograd/generated/VariableType.cpp:24347: expand_as: Assertion `jit::tracer::ArgumentStash::empty()` failed.
```
